t: Nehemiah 9
National Confession of Sin
On*p the twenty-fourth day of this month the Israelites assembled; they were fasting, wearing sackcloth, and had put dust on their heads.
Those of Israelite descent separated themselves from all foreigners, and they stood and confessed their sins and the iniquities of their ancestors.

While they stood in their places, they read from the book of the law of the Lord*s their God for a fourth of the day and spent another fourth of the day in confession and worship of the Lord*s their God.
Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani stood on the raised platform built for the Levites and cried out loudly to the Lord*s their God.

Then the Levites - Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah- said, “Stand up. Blessed be the Lord*s your God from everlasting to everlasting.” Blessed*pn be your glorious name, and*ln may it be exalted above all blessing and praise.

You,*ln Lord,*s are the only God. You*ln created the heavens, the*ln highest heavens with all their stars, the*ln earth and all that is on it, the*ln seas and all that is in them. You*ln give life to all of them, and*ln all the stars of heaven worship you.
You,*ln the Lord,*s are*ln the God who chose Abram and*ln brought him out of Ur of the Chaldeans, and*ln changed his name to Abraham.

You*ln found his heart faithful in your sight, and*ln made a covenant with him to*ln give the land of the Canaanites, Hethites,*ln Amorites, Perizzites, Jebusites,*ln and Girgashites — to*ln give it to his descendants. You*ln have fulfilled your promise, for*ln you are righteous.
You*pn saw the oppression of our ancestors in Egypt and*ln heard their cry at the Red Sea.

You*ln performed signs and wonders against Pharaoh, all*ln his officials, and all the people of his land, for*ln you knew how arrogantly they treated our ancestors. You*ln made a name for yourself that*ln endures to this day.
You*ln divided the sea before them, and*ln they crossed through it on dry ground. You*ln hurled their pursuers into the depths like*ln a stone into raging water.
You*ln led them with a pillar of cloud by day, and*ln with a pillar of fire by night, to*ln illuminate the way they should go.
You*ln came down on Mount Sinai, and*ln spoke to them from heaven. You*ln gave them impartial ordinances, reliable instructions, and*ln good statutes and commands.
You*ln revealed your holy Sabbath to them, and*ln gave them commands, statutes, and instruction through*ln your servant Moses.
You*ln provided bread from heaven for their hunger; you*ln brought them water from the rock for their thirst. You*ln told them to go in and possess the land you*ln had sworn to give them.
But*pn our ancestors acted arrogantly; they*ln became stiff-necked and did not listen to your commands.

They*ln refused to listen and*ln did not remember your wonders you*ln performed among them. They*ln became stiff-necked and appointed a leader to*ln return to their slavery in Egypt. But*ln you are a forgiving God, gracious*ln and compassionate, slow*ln to anger and abounding in faithful love, and*ln you did not abandon them.
Even*ln after they had cast an image of a calf for*ln themselves and said, “This*ln is your god who brought you out of Egypt,” and*ln they had committed terrible blasphemies,

you*ln did not abandon them in the wilderness because*ln of your great compassion. During*ln the day the pillar of cloud never*ln turned away from them, guiding*ln them on their journey. And*ln during the night the pillar of fire illuminated*ln the way they should go.
You*ln sent your good Spirit to instruct them. You*ln did not withhold your manna from their mouths, and*ln you gave them water for their thirst.
You*ln provided for them in the wilderness forty years, and*ln they lacked nothing. Their*ln clothes did not wear out, and*ln their feet did not swell.
You*pn gave them kingdoms and peoples and*ln established boundaries for them. They*ln took possession of*ln the land of King Sihon of Heshbon and*ln of the land of King Og of Bashan.
You*ln multiplied their descendants like*ln the stars of the sky and*ln brought them to the land you*ln told their ancestors to go in and possess.

So*ln their descendants went in and possessed the land: You*ln subdued the Canaanites who inhabited the land before them and*ln handed their kings and the surrounding peoples over to them, to*ln do as they pleased with them.

They*ln captured fortified cities and fertile land and*ln took possession of well-supplied houses, cisterns*ln cut out of rock, vineyards, olive*ln groves, and fruit trees in abundance. They*ln ate, were filled, became*ln prosperous, and delighted in your great goodness.

But*pn they were disobedient and rebelled against you. They*ln flung your law behind their backs and*ln killed your prophets who*ln warned them in*ln order to turn them back to you. They*ln committed terrible blasphemies.

So*ln you handed them over to their enemies, who*ln oppressed them. In*ln their time of distress, they cried out to you, and*ln you heard from heaven. In*ln your abundant compassion you*ln gave them deliverers, who rescued them from*ln the power of their enemies.

But*ln as soon as they had relief, they*ln again did what was evil in your sight. So*ln you abandoned them to the power of their enemies, who*ln dominated them. When*ln they cried out to you again, you*ln heard from heaven and rescued them many*ln times in your compassion.

You*ln warned them to turn back to your law, but*ln they acted arrogantly and*ln would not obey your commands. They*ln sinned against your ordinances, which*ln a person will live by if he does them. They*ln stubbornly resisted, stiffened*ln their necks, and would not obey.
You*ln were patient with them for many years, and*ln your Spirit warned them through your prophets, but*ln they would not listen. Therefore,*ln you handed them over to the surrounding peoples.
However,*ln in your abundant compassion, you*ln did not destroy them or abandon them, for*ln you are a gracious and compassionate God.

So*pn now, our God - the great, mighty, and*ln awe-inspiring God who keeps his gracious covenant— do*ln not view lightly all the hardships that have afflicted us, our*ln kings and leaders, our*ln priests and prophets, our*ln ancestors and all your people, from*ln the days of the Assyrian kings until today.
You*ln are righteous concerning all that has happened to us, because*ln you have acted faithfully, while*ln we have acted wickedly.
Our*ln kings, leaders, priests, and ancestors did*ln not obey your law or*ln listen to your commands and*ln warnings you gave them.

When*ln they were in their kingdom, with*ln your abundant goodness that you gave them, and*ln in the spacious and fertile land you set before them, they*ln would not serve you or turn from their wicked ways.
Here*pn we are today, slaves*ln in the land you gave our ancestors so*ln that they could enjoy its fruit and its goodness. Here*ln we are - slaves in it!
Its*ln abundant harvest goes to the kings you*ln have set over us, because*ln of our sins. They*ln rule over our bodies and*ln our livestock as they please. We*ln are in great distress.
Israel’s Vow of Faithfulness
In*p view of all this, we are making a binding agreement in writing on a sealed document containing the names of our leaders, Levites, and priests.
